intro: Hieracium kemensiforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
